members.name: SFIZZ_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_LABEL_INDEX
members.brief: Index out of bound error for the requested CC/key label.

members.name: sfizz_oversampling_factor_t
members.brief: Oversampling factor.

members.name: sfizz_process_mode_t
members.brief: Processing mode.

members.name: sfizz_synth_t
members.brief: Synth handle.

members.name: sfizz_create_synth
members.brief: Creates a sfizz synth.
members.description: This object has to be freed by the caller using sfizz_free(). The synth by default is set at 48 kHz and a maximum block size of 1024. You should change these values if they are not correct for your application.

members.name: sfizz_free
members.brief: Frees an existing sfizz synth.

members.name: sfizz_load_file
members.brief: Loads an SFZ file.
members.description: The file path can be absolute or relative. All file operations for this SFZ file will be relative to the parent directory of the SFZ file.
members.return: true when file loading went OK, false if some error occured while loading.

params.name: path
params.description: A null-terminated string representing a path to an SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_load_string
members.brief: Loads an SFZ file from textual data.
members.description: This accepts a virtual path name for the imaginary sfz file, which is not required to exist on disk. The purpose of the virtual path is to locate samples with relative paths.
members.return: true when file loading went OK, false if some error occured while loading.

params.name: path
params.description: The virtual path of the SFZ file.

params.name: text
params.description: The contents of the virtual SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_load_scala_file
members.brief: Sets the tuning from a Scala file loaded from the file system.
members.return: true when tuning scale loaded OK, false if some error occurred.

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file in Scala format.

members.name: sfizz_load_scala_string
members.brief: Sets the tuning from a Scala file loaded from memory.
members.return: true when tuning scale loaded OK, false if some error occurred.

params.name: text
params.description: The contents of the file in Scala format.

members.name: sfizz_set_scala_root_key
members.brief: Sets the scala root key.

params.name: root_key
params.description: The MIDI number of the Scala root key (default 60 for C4).

members.name: sfizz_get_scala_root_key
members.brief: Gets the scala root key.
members.return: The MIDI number of the Scala root key (default 60 for C4).

members.name: sfizz_set_tuning_frequency
members.brief: Sets the reference tuning frequency.

params.name: frequency
params.description: The frequency which indicates where standard tuning A4 is (default 440 Hz).

members.name: sfizz_get_tuning_frequency
members.brief: Gets the reference tuning frequency.
members.return: The frequency which indicates where standard tuning A4 is (default 440 Hz).

members.name: sfizz_load_stretch_tuning_by_ratio
members.brief: Configure stretch tuning using a predefined parametric Railsback curve.
members.description: A ratio 1/2 is supposed to match the average piano; 0 disables (the default).

members.name: sfizz_get_num_regions
members.brief: Return the number of regions in the currently loaded SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_groups
members.brief: Return the number of groups in the currently loaded SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_masters
members.brief: Return the number of masters in the currently loaded SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_curves
members.brief: Return the number of curves in the currently loaded SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_export_midnam
members.brief: Export a MIDI Name document describing the currently loaded SFZ file.
members.return: A newly allocated XML string, which must be freed after use.

params.name: model
params.description: The model name used if a non-empty string, otherwise generated.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_preloaded_samples
members.brief: Return the number of preloaded samples for the current SFZ file.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_active_voices
members.brief: Return the number of active voices.
members.description: Note that this function is a basic indicator and does not aim to be perfect. In particular, it runs on the calling thread so voices may well start or stop while the function is checking which voice is active.

members.name: sfizz_set_samples_per_block
members.brief: Set the expected number of samples per block.
members.description: If unsure, give an upper bound since right now ugly things may happen if you go over this number.

params.name: samples_per_block
params.description: The number of samples per block.

members.name: sfizz_set_sample_rate
members.brief: Set the sample rate for the synth.
members.description: This is the output sample rate. This setting does not affect the internal processing.

members.name: sfizz_send_note_on
members.brief: Send a note on event to the synth.
members.description: As with all MIDI events, this needs to happen before the call to sfizz_render_block() in each block and should appear in order of the delays.

params.name: delay
params.description: The delay of the event in the block, in samples.

members.name: sfizz_send_note_off
members.brief: Send a note off event to the synth.
members.description: As with all MIDI events, this needs to happen before the call to sfizz_render_block() in each block and should appear in order of the delays. As per the SFZ spec the velocity of note-off events is usually replaced by the note-on velocity.

params.name: delay
params.description: The delay of the event in the block, in samples.

members.name: sfizz_send_cc
members.brief: Send a CC event to the synth.
members.description: As with all MIDI events, this needs to happen before the call to sfizz_render_block() in each block and should appear in order of the delays.

params.name: delay
params.description: The delay of the event in the block, in samples.

members.name: sfizz_send_hdcc
members.brief: Send a high precision CC event to the synth.
members.description: As with all MIDI events, this needs to happen before the call to sfizz_render_block() in each block and should appear in order of the delays.

params.name: delay
params.description: The delay of the event in the block, in samples.

params.name: norm_value
params.description: The normalized CC value, in domain 0 to 1.

members.name: sfizz_send_pitch_wheel
members.brief: Send a pitch wheel event.
members.description: As with all MIDI events, this needs to happen before the call to sfizz_render_block() in each block and should appear in order of the delays.

members.name: sfizz_send_aftertouch
members.brief: Send an aftertouch event.
members.description: (CURRENTLY UNIMPLEMENTED)

members.name: sfizz_send_tempo
members.brief: Send a tempo event.

members.name: sfizz_send_time_signature
members.brief: Send the time signature.

params.name: beats_per_bar
params.description: The number of beats per bar, or time signature numerator.

params.name: beat_unit
params.description: The note corresponding to one beat, or time signature denominator.

members.name: sfizz_send_time_position
members.brief: Send the time position.

params.name: bar_beat
params.description: The fractional position of the current beat within the bar.

members.name: sfizz_send_playback_state
members.brief: Send the playback state.

params.name: playback_state
params.description: The playback state, 1 if playing, 0 if stopped.

members.name: sfizz_render_block
members.brief: Render a block audio data into a stereo channel.
members.description: No other channel configuration is supported. The synth will gracefully ignore your request if you provide a value. You should pass all the relevant events for the block (midi notes, CCs, ...) before rendering each block. The synth will memorize the inputs and render sample accurates envelopes depending on the input events passed to it.

params.name: channels
params.description: Pointers to the left and right channel of the output.

params.name: num_channels
params.description: Should be equal to 2 for the time being.

params.name: num_frames
params.description: Number of frames to fill. This should be less than or equal to the expected samples_per_block.

members.name: sfizz_get_preload_size
members.brief: Get the size of the preloaded data.
members.description: This returns the number of floats used in the preloading buffers.

members.name: sfizz_set_preload_size
members.brief: Set the size of the preloaded data in number of floats (not bytes).
members.description: This will disable the callbacks for the duration of the load. This function takes a lock ; prefer calling it out of the RT thread. It can also take a long time to return. If the new preload size is the same as the current one, it will release the lock immediately and exit.

members.name: sfizz_get_oversampling_factor
members.brief: Get the internal oversampling rate.
members.description: This is the sampling rate of the engine, not the output or expected rate of the calling function. For the latter use the sfizz_get_sample_rate() function.

members.name: sfizz_set_oversampling_factor
members.brief: Set the internal oversampling rate.
members.description: This is the sampling rate of the engine, not the output or expected rate of the calling function. For the latter use the sfizz_set_sample_rate() function. Increasing this value (up to x8 oversampling) improves the quality of the output at the expense of memory consumption and background loading speed. The main render path still uses the same linear interpolation algorithm and should not see its performance decrease, but the files are oversampled upon loading which increases the stress on the background loader and reduce the loading speed. You can tweak the size of the preloaded data to compensate for the memory increase, but the full loading will need to take place anyway. This function takes a lock and disables the callback; prefer calling it out of the RT thread. It can also take a long time to return. If the new oversampling factor is the same as the current one, it will release the lock immediately and exit.
members.return: true if the oversampling factor was correct, false otherwise.

members.name: sfizz_get_sample_quality
members.brief: Get the default resampling quality.
members.description: This is the quality setting which the engine uses when the instrument does not use the opcode sample_quality. The engine uses distinct default quality settings for live mode and freewheeling mode, which both can be accessed by the means of this function.
members.return: The sample quality for the given mode, in the range 1 to 10.

members.name: sfizz_set_sample_quality
members.brief: Set the default resampling quality.
members.description: This is the quality setting which the engine uses when the instrument does not use the opcode sample_quality. The engine uses distinct default quality settings for live mode and freewheeling mode, which both can be accessed by the means of this function.

params.name: quality
params.description: The desired sample quality, in the range 1 to 10.

members.name: sfizz_set_volume
members.brief: Set the global instrument volume.

members.name: sfizz_get_volume
members.brief: Return the global instrument volume.

members.name: sfizz_set_num_voices
members.brief: Set the number of voices used by the synth.
members.description: This function takes a lock and disables the callback; prefer calling it out of the RT thread. It can also take a long time to return. If the new number of voices is the same as the current one, it will release the lock immediately and exit.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_voices
members.brief: Return the number of voices.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_buffers
members.brief: Return the number of allocated buffers from the synth.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_bytes
members.brief: Get the number of bytes allocated from the synth.
members.description: Note that this value can be less than the actual memory usage since it only counts the buffer objects managed by sfizz.

members.name: sfizz_enable_freewheeling
members.brief: Enable freewheeling on the synth.

members.name: sfizz_disable_freewheeling
members.brief: Disable freewheeling on the synth.

members.name: sfizz_get_unknown_opcodes
members.brief: Return a comma separated list of unknown opcodes.
members.description: The caller has to free() the string returned. This function allocates memory, do not call on the audio thread.

members.name: sfizz_should_reload_file
members.brief: Check if the SFZ should be reloaded.
members.description: Depending on the platform this can create file descriptors.
members.return: true if any included files (including the root file) have been modified since the sfz file was loaded, false otherwise.

members.name: sfizz_should_reload_scala
members.brief: Check if the scala file should be reloaded.
members.description: Depending on the platform this can create file descriptors.
members.return: true if the scala file has been modified since loading.

members.name: sfizz_enable_logging
members.brief: Enable logging of timings to sidecar CSV files.
members.note: This can produce many outputs so use with caution.

members.name: sfizz_disable_logging
members.brief: Disable logging.

members.name: sfizz_set_logging_prefix
members.brief: Enable logging of timings to sidecar CSV files.
members.note: This can produce many outputs so use with caution.

members.name: sfizz_all_sound_off
members.brief: Shuts down the current processing, clear buffers and reset the voices.

members.name: sfizz_add_external_definitions
members.brief: Add external definitions prior to loading.
members.note: These do not get reset by loading or resetting the synth. You need to call sfizz_clear_external_definitions() to erase them.

members.name: sfizz_clear_external_definitions
members.brief: Clears external definitions for the next file loading.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_key_labels
members.brief: Get the number of key labels registered in the current sfz file.

members.name: sfizz_get_key_label_number
members.brief: Get the key number for the label registered at index label_index.
members.return: the number or SFIZZ_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_LABEL_INDEX if the index is out of bounds.

members.name: sfizz_get_key_label_text
members.brief: Get the key text for the label registered at index label_index.
members.return: the label or NULL if the index is out of bounds.

members.name: sfizz_get_num_cc_labels
members.brief: Get the number of CC labels registered in the current sfz file.

members.name: sfizz_get_cc_label_number
members.brief: Get the CC number for the label registered at index label_index.
members.return: the number or SFIZZ_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_LABEL_INDEX if the index is out of bounds.

members.name: sfizz_get_cc_label_text
members.brief: Get the CC text for the label registered at index label_index.
members.return: the label or NULL if the index is out of bounds.
